ARABIC: وَمَن فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا ثُمَّ يُنجِيهِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: or everyone else on earth, if that only meant that he could save himself.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And all those who are on the earth, to save himself.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and all persons of the earth, if only he could thus save himself.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And all those who are in the earth – then only if the redemption saves him!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And all that are in the earth, so that it might save him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And all those that are in the earth, (wishing) then (that) this might deliver him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and whosoever is in the earth, all together, so that then it might deliver him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And all that are in the earth, if then it might deliver him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and all the people of the earth, if that could deliver him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And all who are on the earth; so that this might deliver him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and all those who are upon the earth, if that might deliver him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And all, all that is on earth,- so it could deliver him:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And all that are in the earth, so that it might save him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and whosoever is in the earth, altogether, so that it might save him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And everyone on earth, in order to save him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And whoever is on earth entirely [so] then it could save him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [70:14] and all who are on earth, if it, that ransom, might then deliver him (thumma yunjīhi is a supplement to yaftadī, ‘to ransom himself’).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And all that are in the earth) and at the price of all that which is in the earth, (if then it might deliver him) if Allah might deliver him from the punishment.
